You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE ORDER MANAGEMENT
Payments for Order on Behalf Of

Processing payments is an integral part of the Order on Behalf Of process. Whether you’re using Order Entry or OOBO with Order Management, you need a payment service. You can find payment activity in the order payment summary for each order.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions

There are three ways to configure a payment service. You can use Salesforce Payments, you can use an AppExchange service, or you can configure your own. Depending on what Commerce Cloud platform you’re using, the setup can vary.

To configure a payment service for B2B or D2C Commerce, first add a payment service for store checkout. If you’re using Salesforce Payments, add a payment service before connecting Salesforce Payments to Order on Behalf Of.

To configure a payment gateway for B2C Commerce, either configure Salesforce Payments for OOBO or set up a payment service.

Before configuring Salesforce Payments to work with B2C, B2B, or D2C Commerce, ensure you’ve fully installed and implemented Salesforce Payments.

Salesforce Payments for Order on Behalf Of
Place orders on behalf of customers seamlessly with Salesforce Payments.
Configure a Payment Gateway for Order on Behalf Of (B2C Only)
If you don’t use Salesforce Payments, you can configure a payment gateway to manage payments. Payment packages for some vendors are available on AppExchange.
SEE ALSO
